website_summaries.verdict: A stylish option for the coffee connoisseur who wants a functional brewer.
pros: High-end construction with durable thick-walled glass
Easy to clean and looks great atop the kitchen counter
Makes an awesome cup of coffee
cons: Features strange unit measurements of 5 oz
per cup A traditional cup of coffee is about 6 oz

website_summaries.verdict: Whether you love Chemex for its beauty, quality, or capability for making excellent coffee, this large, 8-Cup Classic Series coffee maker has it all.
pros: Coffee connoisseurs will appreciate this spacious Chemex model's features that includes classic looks, 8-cup capacity, and the brand's signature wood collar and leather tie
cons: The glass is somewhat thinner than some classic versions from the past
but the coffee maker still earns praise for its beauty and craftsmanship

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first use
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product after reading about it and watching several YouTube videos regarding the quality of the coffee. After the first use the glass at the top failed while I was holding it. The glass is VERY thin and apparently not borosilicate. Based on my experience, it does not hold up to use. I would try one of the similar, cheaper alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Much thinner glass
customer_reviews.text: The glass is so much thinner and lighter in weight than the 7 year old one I'm replacing. I am so disappointed. I am concerned about putting it over a very low gas flame as it finishes dripping. Also, what ever happened to including a few filters? As for packing, the chemex box was simply placed in a larger box with no padding surrounding it. I do appreciate minimal waste and packaging, however, this could have easily broken during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Great for cold brew
customer_reviews.text: Is use this as a cold brew set up. Place the coffee in the filter, then stack a pile of ice one top. Then I put it in the refrigerator, and 24hrs later I have the perfect cold brew. Add that to the list of functions if you’re a cold brew fan.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Product has a No Return Policy
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware: I was not aware of a No Return policy on this item. When I purchased it, it said "shipped from and sold by Amazon" and is an "Amazon Choice". I saw no warning that it would not be returnable. I have arthritis in my hands, and I found that the wide grip needed to hold with carafe without risk of dropping it is impossible for my hand and would definitely be too heavy with liquid in it.
customer_reviews.author: JKR

customer_reviews.title: Makes amazing cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: You really can't get behind how good a cup of coffee this method makes until you try a cup. Once you get a system down you can make a pot in about 15 minutes. I do it in the morning for my wife while prepping for the day. No one trying this coffee has said anything other than Wow!, or OMG! this is amazing! or other surprised expressions. You definitely need the pouring pot with the long curved spout for ease of washing the grounds down the inside of the filter. Now, coffee maker coffee is reserved only for the direst of emergencies. It's hard to go back once you've had a taste.
customer_reviews.author: Red Rocket

customer_reviews.title: NOT the same quality as sold in stores
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this to replace a Chemex from 4 years ago that was was knocked over and broke. This version sold on Amazon is NOT the same quality as sold in stores. This one is much lighter - the base especially - and seems much more prone to breaking. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: smk78

customer_reviews.title: Amazing coffee, awkward to pour
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality of the coffee that the Chemex brews. I opted not to get the handled version feeling like it was less sturdy than the design with the wood hand piece. I find that the wood gets quite hot, and is awkward to hold while pouring. It's just a little too big to hold comfortably and confidently. I'm not super excited about reattaching it after removing for cleaning. That said, I love the coffee and I'll get over it. If I ever purchase another I'd consider the handled version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this Chemex coffee maker to replace my old, automatic coffe maker that had begun to leak. I really like the Chemex. It requires only minimally more effort that your standard drip coffee maker, but you can much more easily control your brew characteristics with the Chemex. Also, it looks great on my counter and takes up less space than the old automatic coffee maker. Also, I ordered a fully reusable Able KONE filter to go with it, and the two make a great pair.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R

customer_reviews.title: waiting for filters...
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying a set. Which would come with a few filters to get you started. When I ordered there were no filters under $50. I waited 2 weeks for the CHEMEX to come. I have 2 more weeks to wait for the filters. ( I caved and bought the $50 pack for 100). I hope I can find filters for less $$ in the future, or this will not be a daily used coffee method. I will update my review...when I get my filters.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: very fragile! Weak glass!
customer_reviews.text: Although these coffee pots seem to make excellent coffee, they are very fragile. I have now broken two of them very easily. I most certainly would not recommend this coffee pot unless your countertops and cooking surfaces are all made of pillows. Both times was a normal topple over in the sink while washing and both times they broke. The second one was a replacement for the first one at the cost of $20 plus shipping and handling they sent me a less than perfect model from the factory. Perhaps the company should look into using thicker tempered glass in the future. It is far too thin.
customer_reviews.author: M. Love

customer_reviews.title: Using Chemex for over 40 years
customer_reviews.text: I'm a longtime devotee of making pour over coffee with a Chemex. It's a great product, looks great on the counter and produces smooth coffee every time. It cleans up easily and is only a little more trouble than an electric coffee maker. It quickly becomes your morning ritual. And, the Chemex filters produce coffee which doesn't get rancid, can be reheated, or even enjoyed at room temperature. I break one of these about every ten years, which is a small price to pay.
customer_reviews.author: J. Salvas

customer_reviews.title: I received a defective one and that the bottom logo ...
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective one and that the bottom logo was different from what I used to see, which should have been a clear transparent cross rather than a printed logo with text on it. I am not sure if it is a new model or simply just a clone one. The one I received has cracks on the wood and I tried to return it but wasn't possible because the return option was missing. I have been eyeing on this coffee maker for a quite long time before deciding to get one but unfortunately got a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Functional Design?
customer_reviews.text: The Chemex was a hyped up coffee maker that I found from my own research, but I question its functionality at this price point. Yes, the coffee tastes really great - but I am unsure if it is due to just nicer beans rather than my standard Keurig cup. At first glance, the design seems just like a regular glass beaker/flask so I was unsure of its authenticity for better coffee, but I am definitely getting good cups of coffee with this.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: poor quality glass`
customer_reviews.text: Been using to make coffee at work and after 4 months I was pouring out coffee then crack. Strange place to crack but was from hot coffee. Well Chemex will not cover any breakage. Well would not recommend for quality of glass has gone down.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Sorel

customer_reviews.title: I grew up with a Chemix 30-40 years ago
customer_reviews.text: I prefer coffee that is not brewed in a plastic maker as I can taste the hot plastic. I’ve git sensitive taste buds. You will need a pour spot kettle for this. You will also need to purchase a metal or paper filters. I prefer the metal as I can taste the paper too. It produces a clean tasting coffee. Absolutely love it! It comes in multiple sizes for various needs. It is delicate (more delicate glass than that which I grew up with) and not suitable for a dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Naz

customer_reviews.title: For the price I presumed better quality glass
customer_reviews.text: For nearly $40 I expected the glass to be higher quality. The coffee it produces is great, however, the Chemex loses heat quickly and is extremely fragile. Could have just bought the Chemex filters and poured into a $5 flower vase and got the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Present for Grand Daughter
customer_reviews.text: My grand daughter is headed to college and loves coffees and teas. She requested the things that I use daily to make coffee. The filters are the key to this product. I have noticed since the virus started up that, Amazon has raised the cost of filters. Disappointed but, I understand. I used to be able to purchase to purchase a 100 filters for $10.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The next step in my ongoing descent to coffee snobbery
customer_reviews.text: Elegant and delightfully fussy, this looks great and makes a wonderful cup of coffee. I replaced a French Press for two reasons 2] It was kinda difficult to keep the mesh clean, and 2] In order to keep the grounds out of the coffee it had to be strained through at least one (typically two) metal strainers, which were metal no matter how clean you kept them (I wound up replacing them pretty often). Regardless, this solved both problems and the resulting coffee winds up being one of the better brews I've ever had. Wish I bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse I. Weidaw

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my husband and I. It provides at least two cups of coffee per person if you use the max amount of water. This makes coffee taste delicious and we love how it works. The instructions are clear. Looks great sitting on the counter as decor, when not in use, as well. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alexa Marie

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: This is my every day coffee maker. I actually own two of them, one for me, one for my husband! It makes a fantastic cup of coffee, especially with our home roasted beans. I have had two of them break (our fault) and I’ve replaced them because the flavor can’t be beat. I highly recommend the Chemex if you’re in to amazing coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia USA Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Chemex is the only way to make coffee in my opinion. I replaced my 6 cup With this 8 cup maker. It makes any coffee delicious. You could use cheap grocery store coffee (not that I recommend that) and it will still taste good. The design is so stylish and looks great on a counter top. I used to own a french press, but will never go back after purchasing a Chemex!! Do yourself a favor and buy one!!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee brewing method
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee brewing method there is. Use a coarse grind. Coarser than you use for a drip machine, less than you use for a press pot. I use 24g of coffee and 400g water which makes 2 cups of coffee with room for a splash of milk. It should take approximately 3 to 4 minutes to complete. My general recipe is about 40g water to wet the coffee and let it bloom for 30 seconds. Pour to 250g by the 1 minute mark and let it drain for a bit. Pour to 400g by about 2 minutes and let it drain until done.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Makes a clean, great tasting Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! Makes a great cup of coffee. The coffee maker is only as good as the coffee you put in it and how you make it. I should have gotten the bigger one, but this one works. Dishwasher safe and fairly easy to clean. I would suggest getting a cleaning device to clean the inside. All in all great!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J

customer_reviews.title: It’s great
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, I was skeptical at first. The pour over method seemed ancient and antiquated. But, this product has such great reviews I decided to give it a chance, and I’m glad I did! The flavor is amazing, it does take a little more work but well worth the effort. I don’t know that I will ever go back to a drip coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Loves2shop

customer_reviews.title: So I loved this while I had it
customer_reviews.text: So I loved this while I had it. The issue is I think the glass is a little too thin. I was rinsing it out with water and barely tapped it against the edge of my sink and it busted! It was literally a tap, something I have done thousands of times with my drinking glasses. I might order another one of these *sometime in the future* and try to be more careful with it... But for now I can't justify the cost, no matter how good the coffee is.
customer_reviews.author: hplcman

customer_reviews.title: Really gets my morning routine 😌😰🥺 going 😉✌️
customer_reviews.text: Its perfect for looking like a hipster lesbian while also making some pretty damn good coffee 😳😋 be sure to taste all the fruity 🍎😗 flowery 🌺😌 earthy 😳✌️ and herbal notes 😏👀😰 slurp as obnoxiously as you can to assert your dominance as a tumblr b*tch 😤🤯😉
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: delicious coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I love my pour over. Makes the best coffee I have ever had. I can leave on my stovetop at super low simmer to keep it warm, or microwave the leftover. The only cons: it's glass so it can break easier...but I didn't have to replace my broken for 2 years. Just got my second one last month. The filters are slightly more difficult to get my hands on and the reusable one doesn't work as well for me. Slower to filter, but that might just be the one I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy W.

customer_reviews.title: Giving my French Press some serious competition
customer_reviews.text: I've used a french press for coffee for years now, enjoying it much more than the old brew or Keurigs. Initially I bought this to make a cup or two later in the day, but the flavor produced through pour over is so enjoyable... I find myself using it way more than I thought I would. I do use the Chemex filters, which are a much higher quality than the typical basket-style filter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Alias

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra effort
customer_reviews.text: I've done French Press, Moka Pot, and now pour over. Pour over gives you such a real clean cup of coffee, press can be somewhat muddy sometimes. It's a bit of a ballet doing pour over but the results are great. The Chemex filter takes out everything, no residue, no sludge in the cup. It takes a little study to learn coffee water ratios and the pour over technique, but the taste is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Pandolfino

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade your Coffee Experience
customer_reviews.text: Chemex is fantastic. It brews a large pot easily, yields exceptional flavor, and is visually appealing, unlike most home brew methods. Pro tip for cleaning - put a magic eraser in the bottom with some water and swirl it around a bit. That will do a very good job and is very very easy to do. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W

customer_reviews.title: Glass is too thin, they keep breaking
customer_reviews.text: I love the coffee, but why is the glass paper-thin? Wouldn't THICKER GLASS help insulate the coffee better? Wouldn't THICKER GLASS help it not break from the slightest tap? This thing is made shoddily so that it breaks and then you have to buy it again. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Chemex all the way!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would take more time to make a cup of coffee in my Chemex but in just 4.5 minutes I am able to get the best cup of joe ever. I thought it would look pretentious sitting on my counter but it doesn't. It looks like I want to enjoy the true flavor of my coffee. My coffee maker would get this musty funky smell which would require a vinegar wash and what a pain that was. The Chemex is easy to clean and care for. Highly recommend a Chemex.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite way to make coffee
customer_reviews.text: A great, easy way to make coffee. You won't make a cup that's as good as the best v60 brews, but the Chemex is just so reliable. Cleaning can be a bit of a hassle. You have to take off the wood and leather handle to put it in the dishwasher, and it's cumbersome when you want to put it back on.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Z. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Takes a bit of practice, but it is a well-made, solid product.
customer_reviews.text: As is the design, this product requires a little practice to brew coffee correctly and to clean afterward. However, it is thick enough glass to be a sturdy product , though it does make me cringe every time I set it down a little too hard on my granite countertop. On that note, there are koozies for it and stands/rubber mats.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly J. Neilson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing flavorful coffee
customer_reviews.text: If you want a good cup of coffee, this product does the job. I also purchased the filters for this and that works well. You have to put some effort into slowly pouring boiling water over the grounds, then wait a bit to pour more boiling water, until the carafe if full. I haven’t taken the wooden holder off to wash yet because it looks a little complicated. I wash it after every use. The carafe is well made. It’s amazing how good the coffee tastes.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Best in Class
customer_reviews.text: i have used a Bodum coffee press for years. This was a huge upgrade. We have always purchased premium coffee beans but this is the first time I could really tell the difference in taste. Coffee brews smooth, rich, and perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Highland Piper

customer_reviews.title: Love m Chemex
customer_reviews.text: So love this! A peaceful way to create a cup of coffee! I have a burr handgrinder, coffee beans were hard to find, lol, but once i was all set my first cup of coffee was lovely. Update still love my Chemex, I'm using the melitta brown cone filters #4 doubled.i want to show off my coffee making skills where ever i go, lol! Update! Still Loving this enough toss drip coffee machine,I never could get that thing clean enough 😔 anyway my Chemix is perfect 😊
customer_reviews.author: PViola

customer_reviews.title: Classic and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of our ugly coffee pot and decided to go to a gooseneck kettle and chemex. So glad I did. Now we make just the amount of coffee we need in less than half the time. And, it takes up much less counter space. I prefer making coffee in stainless steel and glass instead of plastic like my old coffee maker. Paired with our favorite Klatch Coffee, it's leaps and bounds above our old way.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Swire

customer_reviews.title: I luv himb
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of regular coffee machine because they're annoying to clean and ruin coffee flavor so I bought one of these during the pandemic and it's lit Clean pours, no grinds at the bottom, great flavor, easy to clean, very happy
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Adding it to my morning routine was so simple.
customer_reviews.text: As a graduate student, I tend to drink a lot of coffee and to save money I started making my own! I originally started by using a siphon but it was a little too time-intensive for my mornings. One of my barista friends suggested learning pour overs and also the Chemex. Absolutely one of the best purchases I have made in my adult life. It is incredibly simple to use and combining it with a gooseneck kettle means it was extremely easy to control the water as needed. I can actually taste the notes that roasters say I should be tasting now!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I've never been a huge fan of coffee and recently learned I was making it all wrong. We have stopped using our Keurig (sorry Keurig) and have purchased some small shop beans...love Moongoat Coffees. I am seriously in love with coffee now and drinking it black, instead of full of sugar and cream! This is a great brewing option and we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Young

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and great coffee
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to grip and pour even for smaller hands. Growing up I remember my best friend's parents having one of these coffee makers (50 years ago), and how sleek and cool it looked. I love making coffee this way, as it allows me to determine the strength. It is faster than a conventional coffee maker and the taste is great.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, not for you if you run late!
customer_reviews.text: I was going to return this and found out they would not ta kn e it back. It requires purchasing several items, causing the price to increase quite a bit. Also if you are jumping out of bed and dont have 10+ min to prepare coffee it is not for you, get the Keurig refillable canisters. Flavor of this is good though
customer_reviews.author: JEMSbyJEN

customer_reviews.title: Love the look but if you want better function, get glass handled model
customer_reviews.text: Got a brush to clean this and you’ll be much happier. I love chemex coffee and this is my third wood collar one, but honestly get the glass handled one. The wood collar is beautiful but a pain in the butt to clean. I chose form over function, but if you want easier you’ll be happy with the glasss handle.
customer_reviews.author: KAF_EmpireState

customer_reviews.title: The best for drip coffee
customer_reviews.text: Since I found out this product existed, I have not used another method. The Chemex filters are ideal but doubling the regular white ones works as a temporary fix. I recommend it to anyone who doesn’t mind taking 5 mins of their morning to make a fresh cup of coffee and fill the house with the aroma of a fresh brew.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabet Iontcheva

customer_reviews.title: Superb coffee every time
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I inherited a Chemex from our marriage nearly 2 decades ago. Sadly it broke and over the years we’ve tried a few more convenient options for coffee: push button, alarm set, and a German-made pour over. Nothing can deliver like A Chemex. And it’s totally worth the little extra time and love put into brewing this coffee. It also seems to me that the shape of the Chemex has been modified incrementally to allow for a faster brew time without sacrificing quality. Thank you Chemex! So glad we’ve reunited.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Rubine

customer_reviews.title: Makes Great Coffee.
customer_reviews.text: It's works as advertised and makes great coffee. It is definitely not ideal for a quick cup of coffee, but that's not really it's intended use. The only real downside is cleaning it. It is a bit of a challenge to get the inside of the carafe cleaned, but that is to be expected due to the hour-glass shape. Overall, I'd would say it was worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: elliotkw09

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not as good as it used to be
customer_reviews.text: My first Chemex broke and this new one that arrived to me is made of a lower quality material. Looks like they now charge twice as much for a separate higher quality unit and have started to make this model out of cheaper material. Based on how it feels I think this will probably break fairly quickly. If this one breaks I will look for a different option next time.
customer_reviews.author: COREY SHEA

customer_reviews.title: Great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: We make some form of pour over everyday in my home. This crafe replaced one that fell on the floor and shattered after 5 years of use. Makes a great cup for coffee, is really unique looking. Buy a reusable coffee sock brand fabric filter to reduce waste.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: If you appreciate good coffee, buy one of these.
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why I waited so long to buy a Chemex. If you care about good coffee, this beautiful piece of glass and wood will change your life! No more plastic, no more ridiculous machines. In fairness, it does take a bit longer to brew than a run-of-the-mill single serving coffee machine (keurig et al) but it's similar to a traditional coffee maker in terms of time. The taste, however, is superior. Worth the extra effort, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Holoman

customer_reviews.title: The STANDARD!
customer_reviews.text: If you are a serious coffee lover and use the pour-over method for your coffee, this is it! The Chemex is the standard. It doesn't get any better. Excellent functionality, flawless design. The filters might set you back a few dollars every now and then but heck it's so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Franck W.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: If you consider yourself a coffee snob or coffee lover and you still have a drip coffee maker for some reason or another, you need to buy this immediately and you won’t ever go back. It’s simply amazing. Truly the best cup of coffee you ever had..everytime you have it.
customer_reviews.author: GymRatt

customer_reviews.title: Neccesity!
customer_reviews.text: I make cold brew and this helps me strain out the coffee grounds. I would be lost without it. Washing the bottom is a little difficult since the opening isn't big enough for my hand, but some super hot, soapy water does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Simply put, good coffee
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 8 cup after my 13 fell off my wardrobe in my dormitory and shattered into a billion pieces. Most experts agree that the pour over method extracts the most flavor and nuance without the body; I agree. Sometimes I wonder if my head's so far up my ass that I have just become such a coffee snob for the sake of acting sophisticated. Then I drink a cup of drip coffee, and I know I can never go back. It's fun to tinker with, and I think it's worth the extra 5 or so minutes a day. Overall, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Buy this & have better coffee for less $
customer_reviews.text: Buy it. Toss the Keurig and upgrade to better coffee at a lower cost and less waste. Make the batch of coffee you want, adjust strength, add flavors. Reheat. Quality product that we have used many times and has been banged around. Strong glass on this. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Cool product, looks sleek
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept. Do know your coffee won't stay hot in this thing for too long though. And it is a little pain in the butt to clean but it does look cool and does the whole single serve coffee setup well.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a coffee maker that would have as little waste as possible and this was it. I like my cup or four of coffee in the morning and using the kcups was making me feel guilty about all the plastic I was going through. I like this drip coffee maker, and I like knowing I am not making so much trash even more. Paired with a reusable filter I am in love!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Chemex: Looks good for the year it lasts
customer_reviews.text: I had the first one for about a year before it broke (bottom cracked and fell off one day while I was about to pour my coffee). Same happened with the Chemex kettle. I think the look of these products is great, but the quality control leaves a TON to be desired, especially for the price of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok.
customer_reviews.text: The glass is really thin and kind of cheap. Thought it would have been thicker and better quality for the price. Nothing fancy about it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As long as to you buy quality beans and creamer - this will not fail you!!
customer_reviews.text: I am able to make the best coffee I’ve ever made with this Chemex! I’m really glad I purchased it. Everyone in the house LOVES when I make the coffee using this. And guests always want a cup when they come over, too!
customer_reviews.author: Ayden

customer_reviews.title: They are made of glass, they break
customer_reviews.text: I went years being careful with my Chemex, but it clinked with another cup in the sink, and a good crack. Not a fault of the glass container, and it's good to know a replacement is at hand if this happens. For as long as I own one, I'll continue to have one of the best cups of coffee around.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Dangerfield

customer_reviews.title: Perfect coffee
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot and method of brewing. Coffee is absolutely delicious. I make just enough for whomever is having coffee as it won't hold the heat long. It brews quickly so it's not a problem to make additional brews. One Tbsp/5oz of water. Perfect every time!
customer_reviews.author: C. Negus

customer_reviews.title: Good Brew
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Keurig which, while convenient, is environmentally wasteful. My coffee now takes a bit longer to brew, but it tastes better. And like most people who use these, I've come to enjoy the simple morning routine of inserting the Chemex filter, boiling water and carefully pouring the water over freshly ground beans. Keep in mind that the coffee can grow cold since the glass isn't sitting on a warmer, but you can solve that either by pouring the brewed coffee into an insulated Thermos, or simply heat each new cup in the microwave. Either way the coffee tastes great.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Cox

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: I love coffee. Have tried many methods. Vintage percolators, et al. My best ever cup of coffee was from a stovetop percolator using cheap coffee during a beach vacation week. Maybe it was the well-seasoned, heavily used pot - or the beach air. The coffee had the robust reddish brown that is my holy grail of coffee greatness, which I've never recreated and rarely had since. After a decade of ultimate disappointments, the Chemex has recaptured some of that basic good coffee flavor without much fuss. My top choice in the reasonably priced range, although I've yet to try vacuum siphon. Wishing you good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Weitz

customer_reviews.title: Fresh and Clean Coffee Taste
customer_reviews.text: My mother enjoys this Chemex tremendously. Each person she serves coffee to from the Chemex says it is the most exceptional, clean, robust coffee they have ever had. The freshness is really wonderful, not sure how it works better than a traditional coffee maker or a french press, but somehow it does. Well worth the purchase and effort with this contraption! Don't buy this if you are a quick cup, or on the go person who is hurried in the morning. This takes a few minutes longer to make.
customer_reviews.author: No name

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love it & the coffee it makes.
customer_reviews.text: As a gift, it totally fit the bill - nice quality, modern yet classic, requested... Bit disappointed at how easily it breaks, but that's the way of glass items. Having a pour-over gives a great opportunity to chat and catch up while you wait, so I'll always lean this way when I have a choice. I'm currently working on a "cozy" for my son's, so it stays a little hotter when he's having coffee solo.
customer_reviews.author: Mamawolf

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Pot
customer_reviews.text: I used this pot in the 70s and always claim it was my favorite pot (and I've used them all!). I was right. The brew Is clean and tasty. So glad to have reignited a memory that turned out to be as good as I remember!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stop waiting and just buy it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always wanted a Chemex and finally bought one after my Bodum carafe broke. I don’t know how or why, but you really can taste the difference with the Chemex!! The best part is, it’s safe to keep warm on the stove unlike the Bodum I was using before. Very pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Love my Chemex
customer_reviews.text: Great product for both amateur folks who enjoy coffee and for enthusiast who like to experience the process of brewing coffee. I love the Chemex - and it looks great on my kitchen counter. One note, this does brew a beautiful cup of coffee. However, use good coffee - it makes all the difference. Finally, I wish Chemex would add a few filters in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pour over coffee maker!!
customer_reviews.text: The BEST pour over coffee maker around! I broke my last one accidentally and took me a bit to replace it. The flavor of the coffee was greatly missed, this makes the best coffee around! Mmmmm mmm mmmmm!
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Great product, makes perfect cup(s) of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Great product, makes perfect cup(s) of coffee. The glass for this coffeemaker is slightly thicker than the previous one we had. That is a GOOD thing! I would not mind it being a millimeter or so thicker still. It makes for better handling / cleaning.This is almost a zen way of making the perfect coffee. For those in a rush or don't want that much involvement, get a good automated coffee maker
customer_reviews.author: Larseroo

customer_reviews.title: My favorite way to make coffee!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE my Chemex! Easy to use, easy to clean, produces great tasting coffee. Doesnt take up much space. I grind my own beans and it took me a few tries to find the right grind size for Chemex but once I did I was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: I should've gotten a chemex a long time ago!
customer_reviews.text: I've heard from many baristas that a chemex is their favorite way to brew coffee. I'm also a barista at a coffee shop, and i've leaned more towards a simple one cup pour over i've had for years. However, I finally made the purchase and I wish I would've gotten this a long time ago. It is so simple to use, so incredibly pleasing to the eyes, and the coffee tastes incredible! My barista self is very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: ruth amaya

customer_reviews.title: Better coffee, every time
customer_reviews.text: I made the switch from a coffeemaker to a chemex two months ago and couldn’t be happier. It’s easy to use, attractive, and makes delicious coffee. I use the chemex filters and while it takes a little more attention than a coffeemaker, the coffee is consistently better. I strongly recommend getting a pour-over kettle for it, so you can pour hot water at the perfect temperature. I also purchased a wire grid so I can keep it safely warmed on my stove. I will use this method forever!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pour over system for any coffee enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It makes enough coffee for 3-4 large cups, or 4-8 regular sized cups. Keep in mind that you’re pouring over a lot of coffee with the 8cup size, so it’s a bit heavy when you pour it, takes a lot more ground coffee to make, and takes more time to brew. If you’re looking to make a few cups for people at breakfast or just want to make a lot of coffee at once, this is the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: More Than Meets College Coffee Requirements
customer_reviews.text: College student here. I love this thing. It makes such good coffee and doesn't leave residual coffee grounds in the bottom like my French Press. Perfect for long-haul study days. I leave the filter covering the spout and the coffee stays warm for several hours, but you can just pop it on the stove if you need to warm it up. Super easy to clean, just toss out the filter with the grounds and rinse and it's ready for tomorrow. I should've bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Laris

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine about 6 months now. It is the best part of my day. You will never go back to regular coffee. This is an instant game changer. I've paired it with Amazon Dark Roast, cheapest beans. Yet rated #3 with the Chemex. It's durable, beautiful and has been great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and makes great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This was a mother’s day present from my husband and our son, and I’ve loved it. Perfect gift. We’ve used it almost every day since I got it. Yummy pourover coffee in a beautiful container. I keep it on display on our coffee bar.
customer_reviews.author: The Smiths

customer_reviews.title: Love being able to send it thru the dishwasher very clean / Great smelling and tasting coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I've used a chemex for 30 years. (I broke a few by dropping nothing survives dropping) I love seeing a sparkling clean coffee pot ready for coffee in the morning, no hidden areas for who knows what to build up. The Coffee tastes great and smells great. I also bought the glass cover for the coffee pot to protects the coffee if I save it for a few days and reheat or make a cold drink from the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia A. Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Suits My needs Best *
customer_reviews.text: It is a bigger size than I need for coffee, but I can also use it to get my tea into a bottle because it has a pour spout. I like the minimalism; the wooden grasp works, however, the glass is thin and must be handled very carefully. Yes, I knew what it was, and in my opinion, grade it four stars for what it is. *The Chemex coffeemaker...is made entirely of borosilicate glass. Borosilicate glass is a type of glass that includes at least 5% boric oxide. The boric oxide makes the glass resistant to extreme temperatures, and also improves its resistance to chemical corrosion.
customer_reviews.author: Bates

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my husband and he as really enjoyed learning how to use the Chemex, and we can tell how much the taste of the coffee has improved. I recommend doing research and following the instructions to get the most out of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: the best & easiest
customer_reviews.text: electric coffee makers freak me out because they're hard to clean and they affect the taste of the cup. this coffee maker is so simple - why complicate a good thing? Makes the freshest tasting coffee, especially if you grind your beans right before brewing. I've been using it for years and just got a second one because i like to make 2 at a time; drink one hot and then ice the other for the next day. The package came in great shape and everything was as expected. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Janssen

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s not easy to hold and pour due to the width of it. It also doesn’t come with a filter so you have to order this separately. It’s nothing special, but it works. I would buy another french press next time.
customer_reviews.author: Shaney Whitbeck

customer_reviews.title: It takes a little practice to get the correct coffee/water ratio for the proper tasting brew.
customer_reviews.text: I like the ability to make coffee to my suited taste. I had one of the Chemex coffee makers several years ago but I broke it (dropped it) and then started using an automatic machine instead. I'm glad to be back with this coffee maker as I can make a superior cup of coffee with this method. The glass maker also is much less intrusive on my kitchen counter than my automatic maker.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Howell

customer_reviews.title: Don't miss out on the best made coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with the purchase. Was exactly as shown and was delivered on time. I thought I would be able to use my insta hot but the water just wasn't hot enough so I purchase an inexpensive Electric Kettle for $30.88 and that made all the difference. The Chemex is an amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s a yes!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this craft after I broke our first Chemex craft. I was very happy with the price, especially compared to others. It arrived very quickly which made me a happy camper as well. I think this system produces the best coffee we’ve ever had in our home. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Use it everyday!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite way to make coffee! I use it everyday. To unlock its full potential you have to use fresh ground whole beans preferably local and recently roasted. I prefer a 16:1 coffee to water ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Copper

customer_reviews.title: It’s what she wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother’s birthday. The only reason it doesn’t get 5 stars is that she she needed to buy additional things to use it even once. I don’t think it needs to come with a full supply of filters, but even one would have meant she could use it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great product, damage to box
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I highly recommend to use to make coffee. Super easy and I’ve always had a good result. I would easily give 5 stars! But my 3 Stars are for Amazon. The box and filters arrived damage. Fortunately, my Chemex is all in one piece, but I’m nervous it might be more prone to breaking since it was jostled so. It’s pretty delicate to begin with. Why would it be acceptable to send someone a product in this condition?
customer_reviews.author: K. Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Best cup of coffee ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best flavor. Obviously a little more work than hitting a button, but with the Chemex the extra work is worth it. Clean, crisp flavor. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: sgstegall34

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat a Chemex
customer_reviews.text: Our original one broke when my husband dropped it. We had to replace it and he was incredibly happy to have his replacement. It's the only way he likes to make his coffee so I'm glad it's back in our home!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Noble

customer_reviews.title: I have used it daily for years and it may ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used it daily for years and it may as well be brand new. My only complaint is the cost of the filters (about $10 for 100 filters), but it's worth it for the quality of the coffee. I believe it's supposed to come with a small glass cap -- at least that was described in the little manual it came with -- but mine didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R.

customer_reviews.title: Best you can get outta coffee
customer_reviews.text: I risked pandemic funding and exposure to buy this. Good coffee in a lockdown is one of the first priorities. Learning curve and appreciation for the mechanism required.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper Quality for the Same Price
customer_reviews.text: This product is inferior to a previous Chemex I purchased from the now-down Chemex website--unless Chemex itself is selling this thinner glass, more poorly constructed knockoff. Wait to order directly from the company. The original Chemex had a beveled base. This one sits directly on the scale or counter. The joy of using a wonderfully manufactured product is gone. You hate to see it.
customer_reviews.author: Magawisca

customer_reviews.title: Love my Chemex
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Chemex. I have the small one for a single mug and this one for two of us to have coffee at a time. Chemex is timeless. Beautiful quality and makes the best, cleanest coffee by far!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi G. Dudley

customer_reviews.title: The. Best. Coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Makes great coffee. Must put it on the burner (cooktop only) to keep coffee warm...but that only removes one star of the 7 stars I tried to give it. The other star was for the filters, which seem wasteful. Seriously, fresh ground beans and this are our heaven.
customer_reviews.author: R. Potts

customer_reviews.title: CHEMEX as expected
customer_reviews.text: Good product, meets all expectations and easy to use. if you are familiar with the product it does great coffee
customer_reviews.author: alex demers

customer_reviews.title: It's an elegant coffee maker but I seem to have ...
customer_reviews.text: It's an elegant coffee maker but I seem to have a recurring problem where, after pouring in the water, coffee percolates back up the pouring spout and onto the counter. What I typically do to alleviate that is to pick up the round, 3-fold, bleach-less filters by the "ears" so there's enough air flow around the filter; it also increases the speed of filtration when I do that as well.
customer_reviews.author: A 21st Century Man

customer_reviews.title: It works. It's great. If you like to do things this way.
customer_reviews.text: My last one broke. (Thanks friend...) But he bought me a new one. So glad to have another one. How could I ever settle for a "real" coffee maker. I'd much rather have one that makes me stand there for a half an hour every morning to pour water through it... :D Haha, it may not be everyone's "cup of tea", but for me, it works. Thanks Chemex.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Fasching

customer_reviews.title: Yummy Coffee
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I had been wanting this for a while, and I finally caved and bought it for his bday. We love it, and the coffee it makes is soo yummy! Won’t be going back to a Keurig anytime soon!
customer_reviews.author: Mandi R.

product_meta.title: CHEMEX Pour-Over Glass Coffeemaker - Classic Series - 8-Cup - Exclusive Packaging
product_meta.description:
Color:Clear

Invented in 1941, CHEMEX has been brewing perfect filtered coffee for generations. Its iconic hour glass shape is so beautiful, it can be found in some of the most prestigious museums worldwide. Its design, timeless and functional, has never been altered. The perfect blend of art and science, simple to use and extraordinary results. Accept no imitations.
The CHEMEX carafe is made from non-porous, tempered borosilicate glass - like that used for labware. Therefore it is totally pure, imparting no flavors of its own and is also resistant to thermal shock. The Chemex can be used for brewing both hot and iced beverages, including coffee and tea.

The Eight Cup Classic Series Coffeemaker used together with the scientifically designed, patented CHEMEX® Bonded Filters, will guarantee that our pour over brewing process will deliver the perfect cup of coffee, without any sediments or bitter elements.

Includes a polished wood collar with leather tie.

Capacity: 40 Ounce
Height: 9 1/8"
Diameter: 5"
Item: CM-8A
